item.title: Federal Court Affirms Right To Give Officer The Finger
item.description: Flipping off police officers constitutional, federal court affirms http://t.co/GMtIPoDX
item.content:encoded: Flipping off police officers constitutional, federal court affirms http://t.co/GMtIPoDX WASHINGTON -- A police officer can't pull you over and arrest you just because you gave him the finger, a federal appeals court declared Thursday. In a 14-page opinion, the U.S. Court of Appeals for the 2nd Circuit ruled that the "ancient gesture of insult is not the basis for a reasonable suspicion of a traffic violation or impending criminal activity." Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: huffingtonpost.com

item.title: Obama Signs NDAA Into Law Despite Controversial Provisions
item.description: NDAA Signed Into Law By Obama Despite Guantanamo Veto Threat, Indefinite Detention Provisions http://t.co/EnthIw2z via @HuffPostPol
item.content:encoded: NDAA Signed Into Law By Obama Despite Guantanamo Veto Threat, Indefinite Detention Provisions http://t.co/EnthIw2z via @HuffPostPol President Barack Obama signed the National Defense Authorization Act of 2013 on Wednesday, despite his own threat to veto it over prohibitions on closing the Guantanamo Bay prison camp. Civil liberties advocates had roundly criticized the bill over Guantanamo and a separate section that could allow the military to indefinitely detain American citizens on suspicions of supporting terrorism. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: huffingtonpost.com

item.title: Here's How Obama's Autopen Works

item.content:encoded: Here's How Obama's Autopen Works #robotsignature http://t.co/3BvJsvs3 Obama used an "autopen," a device that duplicates a person's signature without their presence, to sign the fiscal cliff bill. Here's how it works. Link - Trackbacks
